extendedIngredients.name: beets
extendedIngredients.original: 3 medium beets, peeled and stems trimmed to 2 inches
extendedIngredients.originalName: beets, peeled and stems trimmed to 2 inches

extendedIngredients.name: belgian endive
extendedIngredients.original: 1 large Belgian endive, thickly sliced crosswise

title: Beet Carpaccio with Goat Cheese and Arugula
summary: Need a gluten free, primal, and vegetarian side dish? Beet Carpaccio with Goat Cheese and Arugula could be an amazing recipe to try. This recipe serves 4 and costs $1.85 per serving. One serving contains 202 calories, 7g of protein, and 17g of fat. A mixture of baby arugula, beets, olive oil, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 20 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 48%. This score is good. Try Beet Carpaccio with Goat Cheese and Mint Vinaigrette, Beet & Goat Cheese Arugula Salad, and beet and goat cheese arugula salad for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Using stems as a handle, slice beets paper-thin with slicer (wear protective gloves to avoid staining hands). Toss with vinegar and 1/4 teaspoon salt in a  bowl, then let stand 5 minutes to wilt.                                                                Divide beets among 4 large plates, overlapping slices slightly. Top with goat cheese.                                                                Toss arugula and endive with  1 tablespoon oil and salt and pepper to taste, then mound over goat cheese. Drizzle beets with remaining 2 tablespoons oil.

steps.step: Using stems as a handle, slice beets paper-thin with slicer (wear protective gloves to avoid staining hands). Toss with vinegar and 1/4 teaspoon salt in a  bowl, then let stand 5 minutes to wilt.
Divide beets among 4 large plates, overlapping slices slightly. Top with goat cheese.
Toss arugula and endive with  1 tablespoon oil and salt and pepper to taste, then mound over goat cheese.
Drizzle beets with remaining 2 tablespoons oil.
